src:
Eurasian Economic Commission aprova novas placas gráficas da Gigabyte
Equipadas com 8GB de memória GDDR6.

04 Nov 2019, 19:10

A EEC (Eurasian Economic Commission) aprovou recentemente novas placas gráficas da Gigabyte baseadas na série Radeon RX 5500 da AMD, incluindo a RX 5500 XT, a qual ainda não foi apresentada oficialmente.
Segundo informação divulgada pela referida entidade, as novas gráficas da empresa taiwanesa estão equipadas com 8GB de memória GDDR6 e ventoinhas WindForce 2X. Tudo leva a crer que o modelo Gaming OC conta com o sistema WindForce 3X.
Os rumores mais recentes dão conta que a RX 5500 XT da AMD dispõe de 24 CUs (Compute Units), 1536 stream processors, bem como interface de memória 128-bit.
A EEC aprovou também várias gráficas baseadas na série RX 5700, incluindo modelos Aorus Gaming.
text:
Eurasian Economic Commission approves new Gigabyte graphics cards
Equipped with 8GB of GDDR6 memory.

04 Nov 2019, 19:10

The Eurasian Economic Commission (EEC) recently approved new Gigabyte graphics cards based on AMD's Radeon RX 5500 series, including the RX 5500 XT, which has not yet been officially introduced.
According to information released by the said entity, the Taiwanese company's new graphics are equipped with 8GB of GDDR6 memory and WindForce 2X fans. It seems that the Gaming OC model has the WindForce 3X system.
The latest rumors are that the AMD RX 5500 XT has 24 Compute Units (CUs), 1536 stream processors, as well as a 128-bit memory interface.
EEC has also approved a number of graphics based on the RX 5700 series, including Aorus Gaming models.
